name: Butternut Brownies
ingredients: 1 ½ cups cooked butternut squash puree
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F
Mix all ingredients until smooth
Spread mixture in 8×8 inch pan lined with parchment paper
Bake for 25-30 minutes
Cool completely, then slice into 9 brownies

name: Oreo Cinnamon Rolls
instructions: Bloom yeast in warm milk with 1 tbsp sweetener for 10 minutes
Add remaining dough ingredients and knead for 8 minutes
Let dough rise for 1 hour
Roll out dough, spread filling mixture, roll up and slice into 12 rolls
Let rolls rise for 20-30 minutes
Bake at 375°F for 20-25 minutes
Mix glaze ingredients and spread over warm rolls

name: Oreo Cinnamon Rolls with Cream
instructions: Bloom yeast in warm milk with 1 tbsp sweetener for 10 minutes
Add remaining dough ingredients and knead for 8 minutes
Let dough rise for 1 hour
Roll out dough, spread filling mixture, roll up and slice into 12 rolls
Let rolls rise for 20-30 minutes
Pour ½ cup heavy cream over rolls before baking
Bake at 375°F for 20-25 minutes
Mix glaze ingredients and spread over warm rolls

name: Nutella Pan Brownies
instructions: Mix all ingredients in a non-stick pan
Cover and cook on low heat for 12-15 minutes
Cool slightly and slice into 4 bars

name: Reese's Peanut Butter Cup Cookies
instructions: Mix wet ingredients and sweetener together
Add almond flour, baking soda and salt
Roll into 1 inch balls and place in mini muffin tin
Bake at 350°F for 10-12 minutes
Push a peanut butter cup into each cookie while warm

name: Cookie Dough Cheesecake Pie
instructions: Press ⅔ of cookie dough into pie pan
Pour cheesecake mixture on top
Drop remaining dough on surface
Bake at 350°F for 45-55 minutes
Chill overnight before serving

name: Cottage Cheese Brownies
instructions: Blend all ingredients until smooth
Pour into parchment-lined pan
Bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes
Cool and cut into 9 brownies

name: Pumpkin Spice Bites
ingredients: 1 cup brown sugar (use brown Swerve for low-carb)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F
Mix pumpkin purée, melted butter, brown sugar, cinnamon, and pumpkin pie spice
Cut each biscuit into quarters and roll into balls
Coat in pumpkin mixture
Place into 9×9 inch pan
Bake for 25 minutes or until golden brown
Mix topping ingredients until smooth
Spread on warm bites

name: Toffee Brown Butter Chocolate Chip Cookies
instructions: Make toffee: cook butter and brown sugar to 300°F, spread, cool, and break into pieces
Brown butter and cool for 30 minutes
Whisk together dry ingredients
Beat sugars and butter, then add vanilla and eggs
Mix in dry ingredients
Fold in chocolate chunks and toffee pieces
Scoop 3 tbsp portions and chill for 3 hours
Bake at 350°F for 15 minutes, then cool on rack

name: Fudgy & Chewy Brownie Cookies
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F and line baking sheet with parchment
Mix powdered sugar, cocoa powder, salt, and instant coffee
Add egg whites and vanilla to form thick glossy batter
Fold in chocolate chips
Scoop 2-3 tbsp mounds spaced apart on baking sheet
Bake for 8-10 minutes (8 minutes for fudgy texture)
Cool, then use cup to gently round edges if desired

name: Crackly Chewy Brownie Cookies
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F and line 2 baking sheets
Whisk together powdered sugar, cocoa powder, and salt
Whisk in egg whites and vanilla until glossy
Fold in chocolate chips
Portion 2 tbsp per cookie onto baking sheets
Bake for 10 minutes
Cool on sheet for 5 minutes, then transfer to rack

name: Double Chocolate Protein Brownies
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F
Mix all dry ingredients in a bowl
Beat eggs and fold into dry mixture
Fold in chocolate chips
Pour into greased 8x8 pan
Bake for 20-24 minutes until set
Cool completely before slicing into 12 squares

name: Cookie Dough Protein Bars
instructions: Mix almond flour, protein powder, and peanut butter into dough
Fold in sugar-free chocolate chips
Press firmly into an 8x8 pan lined with parchment
Chill in refrigerator until firm (2-3 hours)
Slice into 8 bars
Store in refrigerator

name: Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Protein Cups
instructions: Mix vanilla protein yogurt with almond flour until dough forms
Fold in sugar-free chocolate chips
Press mixture into silicone cupcake molds
Chill in refrigerator for 1 hour until firm
Pop out of molds and serve
Store in refrigerator

name: Cherry Brownie Protein Bars
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F
Mix all dry ingredients in a bowl
Beat eggs and fold into dry mixture
Fold in chopped cherries
Pour into greased 8x8 pan
Bake for 18-22 minutes until set
Cool completely before slicing into 9 bars

name: Birthday Cake Protein Truffles
instructions: Combine vanilla protein powder with Greek yogurt
Mix until dough forms (add more yogurt if too dry)
Roll mixture into 10 small balls
Roll each ball in sugar-free sprinkles
Chill in refrigerator for 30 minutes
Store in refrigerator up to 5 days

name: Chocolate Peanut Butter Protein Brownie Bites
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F
Mix all dry ingredients
Beat eggs and combine with dry mixture
Spoon into mini muffin tin
Bake for 12 minutes until set
Cool before removing from tin

name: Protein Cinnamon Rolls
instructions: Mix flour and Greek yogurt to form dough
Roll dough into rectangle on floured surface
Mix cinnamon and erythritol, spread over dough
Roll up tightly and slice into 8 rolls
Place in greased baking dish
Bake at 375°F for 18-20 minutes
Mix cream cheese with almond milk for frosting
Top warm rolls with frosting

name: Oreo Protein Cinnamon Rolls
instructions: Mix flour and Greek yogurt to form dough
Roll dough into rectangle
Press crushed Oreos and cinnamon into dough
Roll up and slice into 8 rolls
Place in greased baking dish
Bake at 375°F for 20 minutes
Mix vanilla protein powder with almond milk for frosting
Top warm rolls with vanilla protein frosting

name: Cinnamon Apple Pie Rolls
instructions: Roll out yeast dough into rectangle
Sauté diced apples with cinnamon and sweetener until soft
Spread apple mixture over dough
Roll up tightly and slice into 8 rolls
Place in greased baking dish
Bake at 375°F for 22-25 minutes until golden
Drizzle with sugar-free caramel while warm
Serve immediately

name: Pumpkin Spice Cinnamon Rolls
instructions: Mix flour and Greek yogurt to form dough
Roll dough into rectangle
Mix pumpkin puree with pumpkin spice and spread over dough
Roll up and slice into 8 rolls
Place in greased baking dish
Bake at 375°F for 20-22 minutes
Mix cream cheese with almond milk for frosting
Frost while warm and serve

name: Chocolate Chip Cinnamon Rolls
instructions: Roll out yeast dough into rectangle
Sprinkle dough with cinnamon, brown sugar alternative, and chocolate chips
Roll up tightly and slice into 8 rolls
Place in greased baking dish
Bake at 375°F for 20-25 minutes until golden
Mix cream cheese with almond milk for icing
Top warm rolls with icing
Serve immediately

name: The Fudgiest Oreo Brownies
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together sugar and eggs until smooth
Add melted butter and melted chocolate, whisk until fully combined
Sift in flour and cocoa powder, fold gently with a spatula
Pour mixture into a lined baking dish
Top evenly with crushed Oreos
Bake at 180°C (350°F) for 25 minutes, until edges are set but center remains fudgy
Cool completely before slicing for clean, chewy squares
Enjoy warm or chilled!

name: Zucchini Mousse (Customizable)
description: Healthy, Creamy, Hidden Veggie Base - Add Whatever You Want!
ingredients: 2 cups raw zucchini, peeled and chopped
Your choice of flavor (see variations below)
2-3 tbsp maple syrup or honey (adjust to taste)
instructions: Peel and chop zucchini into chunks
Choose your flavor variation and add to blender with zucchini
Add maple syrup/honey, vanilla (if using), and salt
Blend on high until completely smooth and creamy (2-3 minutes)
Taste and adjust sweetness if needed
Pour mixture into small cups or bowls
Refrigerate overnight (or at least 4 hours) to thicken
Top with optional toppings and serve chilled!
FLAVOR VARIATIONS:
• Chocolate: Add 3 tbsp cocoa powder + chocolate chips on top
• Strawberry: Add 1 cup strawberries + fresh strawberry slices on top
• Peanut Butter: Add 3-4 tbsp peanut butter + crushed peanuts on top
• Vanilla: Just use vanilla extract (simple and clean!)
• Banana: Add 1 ripe banana + banana slices on top
• Mix & Match: Get creative with whatever flavors you like!

name: Three-Ingredient Mug Cake
description: Quick and Easy Single-Serve Protein Cake
ingredients: Optional: Toppings of choice (like peanut butter or dark chocolate)
instructions: Mix protein powder and baking powder in a microwave-safe mug
Add a splash of water and stir until smooth batter forms
Microwave for 60-90 seconds until cake is set
Top with optional toppings like peanut butter or dark chocolate
Enjoy immediately

name: Pumpkin Protein Cookie Dough
description: No-Bake Edible Cookie Dough with Pumpkin Spice
ingredients: 1/2 cup unflavored or vanilla protein powder
1 tsp cinnamon or pumpkin pie spice
1/4 cup PB2 mixed with water to form paste
instructions: In a large bowl, combine almond flour, protein powder, cinnamon or pumpkin pie spice, and salt
Mix PB2 with water to form a paste consistency
Add pumpkin puree, vanilla extract, PB2 paste, and maple syrup to dry ingredients
Mix thoroughly until well combined and cookie dough consistency forms
Fold in chocolate chips
Refrigerate for 30 minutes to firm up
Scoop and enjoy or roll into balls for portioned servings
Store in refrigerator for up to 1 week

name: Six-Ingredient Brownies
description: Healthy Fudgy Brownies with Banana Base
ingredients: Handful of chocolate chips (dark chocolate with 0 added sugar)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C)
Mash the ripe bananas in a large bowl until smooth
Add almond butter, egg, and maple syrup to the mashed bananas and mix well
Add cocoa powder, baking powder, and a pinch of salt
Mix until fully combined and smooth
Fold in chocolate chips, reserving a few for topping
Pour batter into an 8x8 inch pan lined with parchment paper
Sprinkle remaining chocolate chips on top
Bake for 20-25 minutes until set
Cool completely before cutting into 9 brownies
Store in an airtight container for up to 5 days

name: Monster Cookie Dough
ingredients: 1/4 cup water (slowly add, may need less or more)
Optional: mini chocolate chips and/or M&Ms
instructions: In a bowl, combine oat flour, PB2, vanilla protein powder, sweetener, and a pinch of salt
Slowly add 1/4 cup water, mixing as you go (you may need less or more water)
Mix until cookie dough consistency is reached
Add optional mini chocolate chips and/or M&Ms if desired
Enjoy immediately or refrigerate for firmer texture

name: Pumpkin Cinnamon Roll Cake
description: Moist Pumpkin Cake with Cinnamon Swirl
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F and grease a 9x9 inch baking pan
Mix flour, baking powder, cinnamon, pumpkin pie spice, and salt in a bowl
In another bowl, whisk together pumpkin puree, sugar, eggs, milk, melted butter, and vanilla
Combine wet and dry ingredients until just mixed
Mix brown sugar and cinnamon for the filling
Pour half the batter into pan, sprinkle with half the cinnamon filling
Add remaining batter and swirl remaining filling on top with a knife
Bake for 35-40 minutes until toothpick comes out clean
Let cool completely
Mix cream cheese, powdered sugar, and milk for frosting
Spread frosting over cooled cake
Slice into 9 pieces and serve

name: Boiled Egg Chocolate Pudding
instructions: Hard-boil 3 eggs and let them cool completely
Peel the eggs and place in a blender or food processor
Add cocoa powder, sweetener, vanilla extract, and a pinch of salt
Blend on high until completely smooth and creamy (2-3 minutes)
Add milk 1 tablespoon at a time to reach desired pudding consistency
Taste and adjust sweetness if needed
Transfer to serving bowls
Refrigerate for at least 1 hour to chill and thicken
Top with whipped cream or chocolate shavings if desired
Serve cold and enjoy

name: Easy No-Bake Peanut Butter Cookie Dough Dip
description: Indulgent Cookie Dough Dip Perfect for Sharing
ingredients: 1/2 cup brown sugar (or brown sugar substitute)
Graham crackers or apple slices for dipping
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, beat softened cream cheese until smooth and fluffy
Add peanut butter, brown sugar, and powdered sugar
Beat until well combined and creamy (2-3 minutes)
Stir in vanilla extract
Fold in mini chocolate chips, reserving a few for topping
Transfer to a serving bowl
Sprinkle reserved chocolate chips on top
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to firm up
Serve with graham crackers, apple slices, pretzels, or cookies for dipping
Store covered in refrigerator for up to 5 days

name: 78-Calorie High-Protein Chocolate Chip Cookie Cake
ingredients: ½ cup plain or vanilla non-fat Greek yogurt
1 scoop vanilla casein or whey/casein-blend protein powder
¾ cup granular sugar substitute (e.g. Swerve)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F
Mix all wet ingredients in one bowl until smooth
Mix all dry ingredients in another bowl
Combine wet and dry mixtures; stir until even, then fold in chocolate chips
Chill dough in fridge for 15 minutes
Line or grease a round cake pan
Add dough and flatten evenly with damp hands or spatula
Bake 18–22 minutes at 350°F until slightly underdone in the center
Cool 15 minutes, optionally frost, then slice into 10 pieces

name: Brown Sugar Cinnamon Butter Cookies
description: Rich Butter Cookies with Cardamom Sugar
ingredients: 2½ cups all-purpose flour, spooned and leveled
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F and line baking sheets with parchment paper
Cream butter and brown sugar until fluffy
Add egg, yolk, milk, and vanilla; mix until smooth
Whisk flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon in a separate bowl
Combine wet and dry mixtures until dough forms
Mix granulated sugar and cardamom in a small bowl
Roll 1½-tbsp portions of dough into balls and coat in sugar mixture
Place on baking sheet, leaving 2 inches between cookies
Bake 10–12 minutes, until edges are golden and centers soft
Sprinkle with Maldon sea salt and cool before serving

name: Biscoff Mug Cake
instructions: In a microwave-safe mug, whisk cookie butter and milk until smooth
Add flour and baking powder and stir until fully combined
Microwave for 1 minute 15 seconds
Optionally drizzle with warm cookie butter or crushed Biscoff cookies
Serve immediately

name: Brown Butter Pumpkin Spice Espresso Chocolate Chunk Blondies
ingredients: ¾ cup chocolate chunks or chips
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F
In a medium bowl, combine melted butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar
Add pumpkin puree, eggs, and vanilla extract; mix until smooth
Stir together flour, baking powder, salt, and instant espresso in a separate bowl
Combine dry and wet ingredients
Fold in chocolate chunks
Spread batter in a lined 8×8-inch pan
Bake 35–37 minutes, until set and golden
Cool completely, then cut into squares

name: Cookie Fries
description: Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Shaped Like Fries
instructions: Melt 1 stick of butter in a pan until it browns, then set aside to cool slightly
Mix the brown butter with brown sugar and regular sugar
Add egg and mix well
Add baking powder and a little over 1 cup of flour
Using a wooden spoon, gently fold the ingredients together - do not overmix
Add chocolate chips and fold them in
Lightly flour a cookie sheet
Place the dough on the cookie sheet and shape into a rectangle
Cut the dough into strips to create 'fries' shapes
Place in freezer for 5-10 minutes
Remove from freezer, separate the cookie strips, and place them back on the sheet
Return to freezer for 30 minutes
Preheat oven to 375°F
Bake for about 13 minutes until golden
Serve with hazelnut spread for dipping

name: Peanut Butter Rice Crispy Treats
description: Classic Rice Crispy Treats with Chocolate Topping
instructions: Melt coconut oil, peanut butter, and marshmallows in a medium pot over low heat
Stir until fully melted and smooth
Add rice cereal and mix until evenly coated
Press mixture into a loaf pan lined with parchment paper
Spread melted chocolate chips evenly over the top
Refrigerate until set, about 1 hour
